title: Riot support just closed my ticket
body:
Alright, so basically I got perma 
banned, wait im not going to ask for sympathy or anything. I have to point this out because it’s part of the story. So, a while back. My account was compromised and suspended for 14 days, no problem. I did the account recovery procedure and got it lifted ( this happened around **October 19th 2017** the day it got suspended) now I got perma’d and told Riot support I was never suspended, so why didn’t I get a suspension. I got 1 but it was lifted, they say no it was never lifted blah blah blah, that was your 3rd warning. ( which it really was lifted and I’m about to set it to stone that it was lifted with undeniable proof) so, I say ok, if it wasn’t lifted explain this: https://i.imgur.com/Y3gOy2O.jpg
Yepp, those games I played were during my supposed 14 day suspension that was never lifted apparently. And I told them to explain this please and they just closed the ticket without saying anything, found it quite rude, was anxious to hear what they would say.

**UPDATE** They closed my follow up ticket asking for a response.

**EDIT** I also manually had to receive my end of season awards, which I assume I didn’t autmatically recieve due to the automated system thinking I was suspended recently
**EVIDENCE** https://imgur.com/gallery/qTY0i
I don’t think I would’ve recieved them if my 14 day suspension was valid. Cheers
**HUGE EDIT** Perma ban was lifted big shout out to Riot Verdaloth for understanding, also thanks for the support boys.

replies.body:
I looked into this case and there seems to have been a misunderstanding and unclear circumstances that happened.

The original reach out to us was in regards to a compromise that happened to your account which we verified did happen. During the same time, a 2 week suspension was placed by the IFS. When you wrote in about the compromise, we locked it proactively to protect it from the compromiser and overrode the 2 week suspension that was placed at around the same time. Once we verified that you were the original owner, we unlocked the proactive suspension and reset your password.

There was an investigation into whether the behavior in the logs was warranted during the period of compromise and decided that the suspension would remain. This is where we messed up and didn't add the 2 weeks back to your account after removing the proactive suspension. In the tickets, we don't see a record of us telling you the suspension was incorrectly placed and lifted and those interactions should be in your emails for reference.

This is the normal case of an escalated penalty and since your previous suspension by IFS was a 2 week, a permanent was the next in line.

The same actions that net you a 10 game chat restriction will also net you a permanent ban if it is your last strike. It can be very minor (but repeated) things.

And this player wasn't even the one who earned the 2-week ban. The person who stole his account was.

From the way I read Verdaloth's response here,

>When you wrote in about the compromise, we locked it proactively to protect it from the compromiser and overrode the 2 week suspension that was placed at around the same time. Once we verified that you were the original owner, we unlocked the proactive suspension and reset your password.
>There was an investigation into whether the behavior in the logs was warranted during the period of compromise and decided that the suspension would remain.

It was the OP that earned the 2-week punishment. Riot applied a shield-ban when OP said his account was compromised. That shield-ban overwrote the 2-week punishment ban. So when they removed the shield ban his account was completely un-banned even though they should have reapplied the remainder of the 2-week.

And that's where the mistake was, they forgot to place the 2-week back onto the account once the account was secure.

> And that's where the mistake was, they forgot to place the 2-week back onto the account once the account was secure.

And in so doing they ensured that the OP wasn't fairly aware of the consequences of further infractions. Not saying the OP was or wasn't deserving of punishment here but they should not have been misled about the consequences (2 weeks vs. perma) of their actions.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=J6tTbpcF,comment-id=000f0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-10T21:50:44.924+0000)
>
> It was the OP that earned the 2-week punishment. Riot applied a shield-ban when OP said his account was compromised. 

I'm pretty sure it went down like this:

1) Thief earned a 2 -week ban
2) OP wrote in a ticket about stolen account
3) Riot turned 2-week ban into permanent ban to protect the account from the thief
4) Riot investigated the logs and determined the 2-week ban was justified ("you are responsible for the behavior of your account even if you're not the one playing it")
5) Riot reset the password and removed the permanent ban, but forgot to replace the 2-week ban

It never actually says anywhere who earned the ban. But considering the 2-week ban happened "around the same time it was compromised" it's pretty safe to assume the account was stolen and then abused by the thief because "who cares it's not mine."

I know I'm a couple months late, sorry,

But what makes it worse is that they didn't even say this "you are responsible for the behavior of your account even if you're not the one playing it". Legit, so I just assumed it was lifted for good. Which obviously misled me.

A lot of opinions on both sides, 
I looked into it a bit more this morning:

On the side of rolling back the ban to two week suspension:
- We did not confirm or reiterate after lifting the shield ban that the 2 weeks suspension would remain and we did not reapply the remaining time. 

On the side of not rolling back: 
- The compromise when the 2 weeks ban was placed is not clear cut. The waters are muddy around here and I cant share too much details but there is evidence to suggest that perhaps multiple people have intentionally being allowed access/login to this account.  
- OP had had several conversations with the support team about in game behaviour prior to this event. 

It is pretty clear to me that the original suspension was applied for someone elses chat.
However I am not sure OP was being responsible with access to the account - there is a decent amount of "strangeness"

This is about as much details as I can share publicly but if the OP wants to write into us and tell us the whole story, nothing to lose at this stage. I can relook it at - we are not an unreasonable team and this case was well investigated by the team at the time, I would have made the same decision based on the information I am looking at. 

Lastly, since we explained the reason behind the suspension (several times), the matter was considered closed and this is why the new ticket that OP sent was closed automatically. But as I mentioned above, feel free to contact us again and I will relook at the case.

I’m glad to hear you are taking time to reconsider this case, highly appreciated.

While I think this sucks for the OP, I'm going to share my view. Again, as I do legal work adjacent to law enforcement, it is natural for me to use traffic and criminal law as analogy.

Let's say you get arrested for both DUI and drug possession. You go to court, and you're convicted on the DUI charge, because you really were drunk. The drug charge gets dismissed because you prove they weren't really your drugs. Then, due to some oversight the judge doesn't order jail time and/or the court doesn't assess a fine for the DUI.

A while later you get a second DUI. This time the judge orders an enhanced fine because it's a second or subsequent conviction. _The fact you didn't have to serve a punishment for the first crime doesn't reduce the severity of the second or subsequent offense_.

In fact, sometimes it isn't an 'oversight' at all. Judges routinely go easy on a first offense.

Now, if you weren't even the one driving the car and that 'second' DUI was really your first offense, you'd have every right to complain about arbitrary and capricious judgements.

So how is this different from skipping a 2 week ban and going straight to a permaban? Correct me if I'm wrong but part of the reason for the escalating punishments is that they can react and be like: "Oh gosh, I'm a bad person, I should do better". But from what I'm gathering from your response is that he was reached the two-week ban punishment without realizing it because Riot messed up. While I certainly don't want to advocate for someone who is toxic, as Riot has stated previously, very few players reach permaban, they usually reform before that. I think it would be fair to admit that there are extenuating circumstances here (due to a Riot internal mishap) and give him a two week ban.

This is a case that, while I personally don't condone toxic behavior (I am very vocal on the player behavior board against it), I think it is correct to rebuke the permanent ban due to the fact that they had no way of knowing they were under scrutiny for toxic behavior due to the nature of the suspension not being reinstated. A 2 week ban for this instance is fitting for the scenario as you have decided they did deserve a ban for this particular case - but this is a case of no actual 2 week ban jumping to a permanent.

Doesn't the fault fall on you guys for not following the discipline precedure then? If you issued a two week at the same time an account was compromised it would appear that the ban was to protect the account or caused during the compromise. If you fail to reinstate the ban *and clarify what went on*, then you messed it up. You basically just skipped over the entire purpose of the two week suspension which is "hey this is your last chance, get your shit together or else".

I'm not defending OPs behaviour or the validity of his ban, but if he never got his due warning and what happened wasnt made clear, you didn't follow the discipline procedure properly on your end. So how can you permanently ban someone? Rules need to upheld on both ends.

Suspension being lifted (clemency) and punishment being vacated (pardon) are two completely different things. Most often you see the former, where the agent removes the remaining suspension.

Only in extreme cases, have I seen a punishment completely vacated. Instances of that were truly incorrectly applied punishments.

Just because they commuted your sentence, does not mean they vacated your conviction.
